DOC.brief_title: Wii-Fit For Balance And Gait In Elderly Veterans
DOC.detailed_description: Objectives/Rationale Falls major public health problem . They lead cause injury injury-related death age 65 year . Balance gait abnormality major reason fall elderly . Exercise intervention improve gait balance elderly . Despite many proven benefit exercise , many old adult US remain sedentary . This study target improve balance gait use Wii-Fit exercise program . Specific aim 1 . To establish safety , feasibility , efficacy 8-week Wii-Fit program improve measure balance , gait old adult , compare cognitive remediation program , Brain fitness . 2 . To compare effect 8-week Wii-Fit program Brain fitness program , measure biomechanical assessment , adherence , safety , physical activity , fear fall , enjoyment , functional status , cognition quality life . Design 8-week , randomize , parallel group , active intervention study Methods Patients recruit via IRB approve flyer post various location Little Rock North Little Rock CAVHS campuses via referral CAVHS provider . Thirty elderly Veterans randomly assign Wii-Fit arm Brain fitness arm . Both group participate intervention approximately 45 minute 3 day week 8 week . Outcome measure assess baseline , approximately week 4 completion week 8 . Balance gait assess Berg Balance Scale . Secondary outcome measure include biomechanical test gait balance , Safety , Adherence , measure functional status , cognition , quality life , fear fall , physical activity physical activity enjoyment .
DOC.criteria: Subjects age ≥ 60 year Fall risk measure Berg Balance Scale ( BBS ) ≤ 52 Normal cognition measure Mini Mental State Exam ( MMSE ≥ 24 ) Able consent Subjects use wheel chair walker mobility Subjects absolute contraindication per ACSM guideline Any medical condition ( per relative contraindication per ACSM guideline ) opinion study physician likely compromise ability safely participate exercise program .
